meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Executive Accused of Fraud CA, formerly known as Computer Associates, accused its founder, Charles B. Wang, of masterminding a huge accounting fraud at the company.
G.O.P. Hopeful Spends Big Mitt Romney, a Republican candidate for president, spent nearly 60 percent of the $20.7 million he raised in the first quarter.
T: Beauty The Times Style Magazine looks at everything you need to know about cosmetic laser treatments and the latest news at the spa: DNA testing.

The Greening of Geopolitics How can America regain its international stature? By taking the lead in alternative energy and environmentalism. On nytimes.com: A video feature in which the article's author, Thomas L. Friedman, discusses how the immense challenge of a greener world can be met.
